The Allen Farmhaus brings a fresh perspective to vintage charm.  Located right outside of the New Braunfels city limits, these 52 acres of rolling hay fields provide an unparalleled backdrop for the perfect wedding.  A majestic setting under a historic 300 year old oak tree, a perfectly framed view of the rolling land for miles, and custom made grand sliding barn doors are only a few of the many options for the ideal on site ceremony location.  Our reception barn features sliding barn doors throughout the space, providing an unobstructed view straight through the structure.  The focus on bringing the outdoors in has never been so perfectly captured

My name is Allison, and I’m a wedding photographer and educator! I’ve been serving sweet couples for five years, and have been a part of over 100 wedding days! I’ve been featured in international publications and recently inducted into The Knot Hall of Fame(it's kind of like winning a Grammy). I truly LOVE getting to know my couples and celebrating with them on their #bestdayever. I’m basically your behind-the-scenes bridesmaid with a camera who will probably ugly-cry at your wedding.

MY PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE? 
IT’S JOYFUL, TIMELESS, AND ROMANTIC–BUT MOSTLY JOYFUL!

My goal is to make your day EASY and ENJOYABLE. I love candid moments, you know, when mom is crying in the front row, or when your groom sees you for the first time-but I also love to create beautiful images of couples with light posing involved to make you look your best (don’t worry, these won’t look like your yearbook pictures)! Your wedding day should be full of joy, love, and lots of laughter, and I think your photos should reflect that.

column4:
I have a decade of experience doing events – weddings are my specialty.  I am very detail oriented in the planning and execution of an event.  I bring the fun and the energy to your guests and bring the calm and confidence to my bride and groom.

Here is a little about me and my thoughts about weddings.  When we meet, I want to focus on getting to know you – how you met and hearing about your plans, thoughts, ideas and dreams of what your perfect wedding day looks like.

Hiring wedding vendors can be a daunting task!  The DJ tends to be a very personality-based decision; you can’t walk the grounds, admire a portfolio or do a tasting.  I have found it best to set up a face-to-face meeting and see if my personality is a good match to your expectations.  After all, the DJ will not only be providing the background for your entire event, he/she will also be the voice of your wedding.  A good DJ will also be your “go-to” person for any and everything during your event.  Having someone with a personality suited to yours can prove to be an invaluable asset.  And oh…how a bad DJ can be your worst nightmare.  I hear horror stories all the time and it breaks my heart how one person can do so much damage to an event.

I have been DJ’ing since ‘07 and have hundreds and hundreds of weddings under my belt.  Experience… there is nothing better to prepare you for the things a wedding ceremony and reception can throw at you.  My goal for my bride and groom is to have no idea of anything other than perfection…even if that may not have been entirely the case behind the scenes.  I want you to spend your event in a bubble of bliss and if there is some drama, there is rarely a need for it to have any effect on the 2 people who have been planning this day for months or years.  Almost everything that goes off course, can be corrected without popping your bubble.

All I want my bride to have to worry about on the day of her wedding is to look pretty.  The rest of the event – leave up to me and the other professionals you have hired to deliver the day you have dreamt of all your life.  Because once the day finally arrives, you don’t want to worry about linens, chiffon chairs, cake flavors or center pieces.  All you should have to worry about is soaking up the moment: enjoying your last hours being single, your mother and grandmother there telling you about their wedding day (again), finally putting on the dress you chose after the hundreds you looked at and the dozens you tried on, blasting your favorite music with your girls as you all get ready together, did your fiance and the groomsmen make it back from the golf course (ok…maybe not that last one).

I truly enjoy what I do!  I love meeting engaged couples and hearing about your ideas and plans and discussing how we can make them a reality and perhaps even enhance them to places you had not thought of before.  I love the process of choosing the music that will be the backdrop to the event: the ceremony, the first dance, the parents’ dance, the bouquet and garter…or whatever events you choose to incorporate into your night.  I have worked with couples who know every song from the minute the first guest arrives to those who have not even thought of that part yet.  I am happy to take notes and listen or to share ideas and help brainstorm songs that might fit the mood you are going for at each phase.

I have been to more weddings in a month than most people attend in their lifetime.  There is no right or wrong way to do things.  There are logistical parts of weddings that perhaps you have not thought of – but ultimately anything I ever suggest can be met with, “that’s interesting…we don’t want to do that” and it will not bother me at all.  I will talk through each scenario to find a solution that works for you and doesn’t point you toward a potential pitfall.

Lastly, wedding DJ and club DJ are 2 very different skill sets.  I think either would be challenged doing the other job.  Club DJs typically stay within the current music, and do a lot of beat mixing for mostly the same age crowd with the same music tastes – whatever that club’s genre might be.  Although I do some beat-mixing, a wedding DJ has to consider the 3 to 4 generations attending your wedding.  Grandma doesn’t want to hear the same music your 14 year old niece wants to hear, and your guests who ride horses for fun don’t generally listen to the same music as your guests who ride Harleys for fun.  The ability to read the room is key once everyone hits the dance floor.  I know budget restraints might cause you to think an uncle with an iPod is a good option, but the MC job is the most challenging aspect for a wanna-be DJ.  Love Shack will sound the same if I play it or your uncle plays it…but addressing the hundreds of strangers in the room on a microphone is outside of most people’s comfort zone.  One needs to log a few hours to really become comfortable at it.  Just for the record, I’m not crazy about Love Shack – the music you don’t want to hear is equally as important as the “you’ve got to play or you’re fired” songs on your list.

In my opinion, the easiest part of the night is once we open up the dance floor, but that is what most people think of first when they think of the DJ.  Where you get the most out of your wedding DJ is keeping your event on pace, keeping everyone informed of what is going on, and (most important) keeping key players aware of what is coming next.  No surprises…unless planned.  This in turn keeps everyone calm, knowing your DJ has the event well in hand; and my bride and groom can be in the moment and soak up every minute of the event.  In the blink of an eye – you will be back in your honeymoon suite looking at your rings and giggling about calling each other husband and wife.

Welcome to Blanco BBQ! Come join us under the majestic Oaks and country setting inside the city limits! We can cater your event at our establishment or anywhere you choose since we offer on- and off-site catering!  

Great for weddings, parties, office gatherings,  game days or any special event, we offer a variety of menus and services to fit all your needs. You pick the Menu, add the services you want, and we'll do the rest! 

PRIVATE PARTY ROOM
Need a venue for your Rehearsal Dinner or Wedding Reception? We have a spacious rustic style “Party Room” with a capacity of 125 guests for your special event, anniversary, reunion, birthday party, or company meeting (Have your room rental fee waived for 50 guests or more!)... You can use it for just about anything!

We start with the BEST ingredients, 100% Black Angus Brisket, Homemade Polish Sausage, hand-selected pork ribs, pork butt, bone-in-hams, whole chicken, and turkey breast. We smoke our meats with a mixture of Texas Oak and Pecan wood and brine our chicken and turkey for 8 hours, to be super-moist and flavorful. We make all of our own spice rubs, each one specifically for each meat. Our fresh chicken tenders are hand breaded in New Orleans Special Flour. 

 CATERING
Great for your Off-premise Bridal Shower, Rehearsal Dinner or Wedding Reception, we will deliver (Up to 50 guests with one day advance notice).   
We can provide: 
* Your choice of Meat (Brisket, Chicken, Turkey, Ham, Sausage and Pulled Pork 
* Sides - Don’t forget to pick 3 of our homemade side items!
* Desserts - You have to try our homemade desserts! We say homemade for a reason!
* Fixins' - All the fixins are included like pickles, onions, jalapenos, sweet + hot carrots, homemade BBQ sauce, fresh baked rolls.
* Paper Products - We even provide plates, cutlery, napkins
* Beverage - Sweet or Unsweet Tea, lemons, cups and ice.  
* Set Up - We set it all up, and everything is disposable making cleanup a snap! So don’t hesitate – give us a call or go online and place your order today! You don’t even have to lift a finger!

LIVE MUSIC
You’ll  love our Live Music Series! You may even want to try line dancing classes – or if that’s too hip – try our square dancing classes. Relax and enjoy the view from our outdoor patio set under majestic Oaks, backing up to Hardberger Park.The view is absolutely beautiful and there’s also playscape for the kids!

MARKET STORE
We pride ourselves on our delicious food and wonderful atmosphere. Here you will find one-of-a-kind antiques for sale and our very own Market filled with Texas-produced jams, jellies, sauces and more. Our Market has fine wines and our homemade spice rubs. Don’t forget your BBQ tools ,  t-shirt, hat & koozie and you’re good to go for your very own weekend BBQ!

DRIVE THRU / PICNIC PACK
Our Drive-thru offers 9 different Family Value Packs. If you’re going to the park, make it a Picnic Pack – with plates, cups, ice, silverware and wet naps. Don’t forget your gallon of Blanco’s Sweet (or Unsweet) Tea.

 We offer a premium product that’s family friendly. Front and back patios with a play area for the kids!  Come on out and visit us for a fun, festive, and memorable time!   Come taste the difference at Blanco BBQ!

column4:
Nestled in the middle of Blue Star Arts Complex, The Brick offers a baroque style to industrial chic.  We are your blank canvas where your ideas and vision will come alive.

Upon entering the main venue, you will be immediately drawn to our two 80-year-old German chandeliers as the centerpiece of the room.

The Brick at Blue Star is rich in San Antonio history! Originally part of the farmland belonging to the Mission San Antonio de Valero (popularly known as The Alamo), the King William neighborhood was settled in the 1860s by German immigrants who built many of the large historic homes still in the area today. The city designated King William as its first Historic Neighborhood in 1968.

In addition to the Blue Star Contemporary Art Museum, the complex is home to apartments, restaurants, theater, and a number of smaller galleries and artist studios. San Antonio’s first brewpub, the Blue Star Brewing Company, opened here in 1996. The Blue Star Arts Complex was the city’s first mixed-use development and the seed of its creative economy.

With reception area, prep kitchen, projection walls and so much more, come see what Brick at Blue Star has to offer for your special event.

To receive a personal tour and to check availability, please contact Trina at (210) 707-7474 for more information.

Bridesmaid dresses by Jasmine Bridal and Venus Bridal. We offer bras, petticoats and various accessories including but not limited to: veils, jewelry, tiars and head pieces. We offer in house alterations/ redesign services. Allow us to incorporate your something old into your something new.


We are open Monday throught Saturday from 10am - 6pm; closed Wednesday and Sunday. Please call or email to make an appointment whether it is to try on bridal gowns or for alterations. By appointement only no walk ins. Maximum guest allowed per bridal consultation will be 3 (including bride)
We look forward to hearing from you: (210) 408-4560, info@bridesbyelizabeth.com

column4:
The Cadillac Bar Restaurant is a legendary establishment. Its beginnings can be traced back to New Orleans in the early 1920''s.

Today, San Antonio has the pleasure of having its own Cadillac Bar Restaurant with the same food and drinks that have been satisfying customers for more than 70 years.

Plan your Reception or other Wedding Event with us and you''ll remember it forever! Our Banquet Facilities adjoin the restaurant and feature natural limestone walls and 12-foot ceilings. This is a two-story complex that has been expertly restored to its original grandeur. We offer three banquet rooms and a spectacular entryway cantina.

Our rooms include: the El Dorado for large gatherings and the Seville and Cimarron for smaller groups. Outdoor occasions are perfectly accommodated in our classic brick courtyard area immediately behind the restaurant. Our experienced staff will be happy to work with you in every possible way to make your function a complete success. We handle all the details. Select from a menu that features delicious steaks, quail, shrimp, frog legs, oysters, soft shell crab, fajitas, seafood specialties, and the finest Mexican cuisine.

The Cadillac Bar Restaurant is a legendary establishment. Come and enjoy.

column4:
Hello!  Welcome to my section of San Antonio Weddings: Caitlin’s Creations Photography and Design.  Let me tell you a little bit about myself, so we can concentrate on YOU during our consultation.

I have been in the photography field for over eight years, working under various photographers. I discovered my passion for photography and weddings, and have been enjoying my career ever since--especially since branching out into my own business in 2008. I look at every photography session, and every event I capture as a unique experience--one to learn from and have fun with. Your wedding will not be just another job for me, but a special day that I have the opportunity to be a part of. You are not just another client, but a bride getting ready for the most exciting day of her life!

It is so important to have a good relationship with your photographer--they will share some of the most emotional, stressful, and wonderful moments of your life. I enjoy building a relationship with you, so that you are relaxed and having fun on your wedding day, not worrying about a camera in your face!

Besides my passion for photography, I also specialize in (and really enjoy!) portrait design. What will you do with your portraits? I am a firm believer in your rights to own your images, and you will always receive an image CD with my services. But what comes next? Will you print a bunch of 4x6s just to put them into a box in your closet? This is where my special design abilities come into play. I will sit down with you for a design consultation after the wedding, and then create a beautiful custom album to tell the story of your day, with your personal style in mind. Many photographers send their designs out to an anonymous graphic designer, that you will never meet--I know YOU, and design unique creations with you in mind. Many of my brides choose me for my personal service AND design ability all in one, and most decide to let me take care of everything for them, from their fun Save the Date magnets or cards to their unique custom Invitations and Guestbooks, a special Boudoir Book for their husband to be, and even personal Thank You card designs. The Wedding Album is the final result of months of getting to know you throughout our sessions, meeting, and design consults, to make that special design just for you.

Please take some time to look at my website--I know you will be happy with what you see! My portraits and custom designs speak for themselves, and you will find out how easy it is to be able to invest in beautiful, artistic, and personalized photography for your wedding.

 Call 210-452-0784 or email Caitlin's Creations when you are ready for your free consultation.  I look forward to meeting with you to discuss your special day, and to create that perfect package to fit all of your needs.

column4:
The beauty and relaxed elegance of the Texas Hill Country is the setting for Canyon Springs Golf Club, located in the Stone Oak Parkway area northwest of the 281 & 1604 intersection. 

Offering both the Pavilion and Clubhouse for receptions, rehearsal dinners and bridal showers as well as the romantic Waterfall as a site for photographs and wedding ceremonies, Canyon Springs is a beautiful setting for any wedding celebration.   

A San Antonio one-of-a-kind, the Waterfall is a unique setting for friends and family to gather in witness of wedding vows. The Waterfall may accommodate ceremonies from 20 to 300 people or may offer the backdrop for wedding day photos, bridal portraits or engagement photos.   

The Pavilion, accommodating 80 to 450 guests, is enclosed by four large French doors leading to a covered patio wrapping the Pavilion and bordered by an expansive lawn filled with Texas Live Oaks. 

 

Features dating to the 1800s bring added charm to Canyon Springs’ Clubhouse, which may accommodate from 30 to 425 guests. Both rooms include personalized service and a golf outing for the groom on Canyon Springs award-winning golf course.

Voted Best Place To Hold a Wedding by Avid Golfer magazine!

column4:
Welcome to Carriage Hills Ranch - An Authentic Texas Hill Country Wedding Venue

 If you’re here in search of a venue with a true Texas-vibe, to celebrate your I Do’s and dance the night away in the heart of the Texas Hill Country, you’re in the right place.

You might be looking for a venue that’s a mix of beautiful outdoor and indoor space that will treat you and your out-of-town guests like family. One that makes planning your big day with all of your favorite wedding vendors a joy, and includes lots of extras (at no extra charge) making planning easy.

We’re so glad you’ve discovered our little corner of paradise at Carriage Hills Ranch.

As a family-owned working ranch, we’ve been hosting weddings for a lot longer than its been a trend in the Hill Country. We have a servants heart, believe in doing what’s right - not just what’s easy, and love our military, veterans, and first responders.

 

 

 Accommodations:

  • Exclusive use of the 5,400 sq. ft. Reception Hall and the grounds

  • Three ceremony locations:

    • Gazebo overlooking our four and a half acre wet-weather lake with limestone amphitheater-style seating

    • Outdoor Texas limestone fireplace and patio

    • Carriage Hall in case of inclement weather

  • Climate-controlled Reception Hall with caterers kitchen, stage, 6’ bar, 10’ buffet table, dance floor, and indoor restrooms (wheelchair accessible)

  • Hundreds of decorative, display, and antique items available for your use

  • Numerous areas for photos in addition to our ceremony areas such as our Texas limestone bridge with waterfall; Historic San Antonio Streetcar; terraces; oak trees and more

  • Use of our tables, linens, and Chiavari fruitwood chairs with cushions for use inside the reception hall for 220 and 200 white folding chairs (for outdoor reception use)

  • Outdoor bar and appetizer area on our historic Streetcar or use our fireplace patio area

  • Use of our fireplace - (including wood) for making s’mores or staying warm on chilly evenings

  • Climate-controlled Bridal Cabin and Groom’s Quarters

  • Use of Antique Buckboard Gift Wagon; Antique Display Stand; 6 Whiskey Barrels; Wine Cart; Portable Speaker

  • Romantic lighting throughout the property, including terraces and reception hall

  • Outdoor Lawn games

  • Free on-site lighted parking (with handicap parking) and parking attendant

  • Five-passenger golf cart available for assisting guests

  • Off-Duty Police Officer(s) on-site for 4 hours during the reception for security

  • Carriage Hills Ranch team member on-site on the day of the event

  • 2 hours for on-site Bridal Portraits taken prior to the wedding date, on any Couples Open House date (photographer not included)

  • 1 hour of Rehearsal Time - this may be scheduled the day before the wedding, if available

  • Set-up of tables and chairs in Reception Hall and clean-up

Come see for yourself why The Chandelier of Gruene is one of the most talked about venues in the Hill Country! Located on spectacular secluded acreage in the Texas Hill Country just minutes from Historic Gruene.

As you enter the property, an oak canopied lane leads you to our picturesque open-air chapel nestled amongst a grassy meadow surrounded by majestic towering oaks. Just steps from the chapel, you find our impressive 12,000 square foot venue accompanied by 3,200 square feet of stunning covered patio area.

The venue will comfortably seat 50-500 guests indoors with plenty of space outdoors for your guests during receptions, corporate meetings, family reunions or any event of your dreams!

Throughout the property you will find architectural treasures such as cathedral ceilings, exposed rough sawn cedar beams, hand troweled walls, Chicago brick, gas lanterns, and several splendid crystal chandeliers. All of this combines to create the perfect venue to host the event of your dreams!

column4:
Couture Events

Couture Events is a full-time wedding and  event planning company in New Braunfels, Texas. Founder and lead coordinator, Jill McCarty, has taken her high-energy style and experience and developed a business to assist those who are dreaming of creating the perfect day and the perfect event. Whether the affair is a small intimate setting, a family bar-b-que, corporate event, fundraiser or the most important day of a couple's life- a wedding, Couture Events will tend to every detail. Our focus is always to advocate for our clients and their interests. As our client, you can rest assured your day is as important to us as it is to you. Your beautiful event is also our success.

Our goal at Couture Events is to bring a special touch and fresh outlook to every event. We are there for you every step of the way. If you have only set the date and want us to do it all or you just need assistance along the way, we will be there whenever you need us.

Our professional staff will handle all the details so you can throw the best event with no worries. We want you to enjoy the planning process, too! Most importantly, however, we want you to enjoy your big day. We strive for our clients to feel that they can attend their event while we attend to their event. Let us help turn your dreams and vision in to a stylish Couture Event.  


Turn your vision into reality

Jill McCarty has been in the business of entertainment and fashion for over 20 years. As a singer, band leader, emcee, DJ and KJ, she has seen most every event happen from the inside out. While performing at numerous weddings, receptions and events, she realized that many times there was a great frustration behind the scenes. Generally, those with the most to celebrate are the ones stressed to the max and worried about the details. While planning her own wedding, she knew she had a knack for making beautiful things happen. Friends and family saw her passion and attention to detail, and quickly began asking for assistance. Many wedding and events later, she decided to follow her passion. She studied Wedding and Event Planning through QC Event Career School and received her diploma and an Award of Merit for outstanding creative ability.

Jill also has many years of experience in the fashion industry as a buyer for a major American-branded company. She prides herself in staying current with the trends and she always listens to what the customer wants. She has an outstanding record of customer service, and is anxious to bring that enthusiasm to each and every client, family and vendor she works with. Jill would love to help turn your vision into a reality. When you hire Jill, you hire a friend and an advocate for you. 

- Jill McCarty Founder & Lead Coordinator

column4:
My Story

My name is Laurie Love and I am so excited to introduce you to Cru, our vintage rental company based in Boerne, Texas.  Having worked at a home decorating store for over 7 years, I've developed a love for assisting others with their decorating needs.  I grew up in a family who loves to go antiquing, searching for fabulous vintage finds and creating works of art from them. This is how Cru evolved. 

Now, not only do we have an excuse to treasure hunt more frequently, we have the opportunity to help others create their dream event with a vintage flair. One of our favorite challenges is searching for unique pieces to create that special look to make your day even more memorable.

Plan your Event

We would love to consult with you to discuss plans for your special day. We have many items to choose from specializing in vintage furniture, whiskey barrels, accessories, linens and tabletop decor. Items are continually being added to our website so if you're looking for something you don't see just ask.  If we don't have it, we can most likely find it. It would be our privilege to design your next event, so please contact us for a complimentary consultation. 

We serve all of San Antonio, Boerne, Comfort, Kerrville, Fredericksburg, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Kyle, Austin, La Vernia, and the hill country.

Established in 1976, Cutting Edge Entertainment has been determined to be driving force in making a couples wedding day something they, and their guests, remember positively for years to come. We have been hired to perform at thousands of weddings since we opened our doors here in South Texas. We are successful still after all those years because we never lose sight of the fundamentals. We know what it means to be a true Master of Ceremonies in our execution and announcements. We know not every wedding is the same, so we read your unique crowd and play music they will react to with high energy throughout the entire night.

While we provide a user friendly worksheet to help simplify the process of selecting individual songs for important moments, we also take the time to review your overall various music genres and selections in the months and days to come leading up to your wedding. We presently have twelve trained and professional DJs on our staff. This means your event is always guaranteed and you’d never have to worry about whether or not your DJ will show up. Our service includes a professional, outgoing, DJ in tuxedo, an unlimited music supply, our standard basic lighting setup, as well as addressing all announcements needed throughout your day.

We encourage you to visit our website. Once there, you can view our demonstration video, receive itinerary assistance, request a free information packet, or setup a free in-person consultation with one of our managers to discuss what will ensure your wedding is unique and memorable in the best way possible.

Award Winning Photographer and Conference Speaker, David Pezzat began practicing photography at the age of sixteen. He has continued to grow over the years learning new techniques, developing his talent, and sharpening his artistic edge.

Before becoming a professional photographer, David used his design and photography skills working for an advertising agency. He has photographed celebrities, business professionals, and politicians and has filmed music videos, commercials and high profile events. His photographs have been published nationally in high distribution magazines, billboards, commercials, and other various advertising medias.

David’s desire for adventure and world travel has led him to Destination Weddings. His work has taken him to San Francisco, Taos, New Mexico, Las Vegas, New Orleans, Hawaii, Guadalajara, Guanajuato, Cancun, Playa del Carmen, Puerto Rico, Columbia, Panama and locations throughout his home state of Texas.

With his growing reputation and following, David has been asked to mentor fellow photographers at conferences such as, Bodaf (Mexico), Wedding & Portrait Photographers International (USA), Premera Convention de Fotografos en Columbia (Medellin, Columbia), Sociedad Mexicana de Fotografos Profesonales (Guanajuato, Mexico), Foro de Fotografos (Argentina).

David’s work with Destination Weddings has been featured in such publications as: Maxwell Brides Magazine, The Valley Wedding Pages, Grace Ormond Wedding Style Magazine, The Knot and Wedding Wire.

column4:
Elliott Hamilton is rapidly becoming recognized as one of San Antonio's premier wedding photojournalists having learned from the photographer credited with the creation of the photojournalistic approach to wedding photography. 

News photojournalists attempt to tell a story; to capture emotion, to capture the "decisive moment."  Wedding photojournalism is all about seeing and then capturing the natural, spontaneous, perishable, fleeting emotions and expressions-the fun and happiness-the really great moments of your wedding day-the images that allow you to relive and re-enjoy your wedding day when you view your photographs. Doing this requires a knowledge of photography and the right equipment, but it also requires a photojournalist's "eye" and good timing.

Alfred Eisenstaedt, a Life magazine photographer called by some "the father of photojournalism" once described many photographers saying, "They know more about photography, about lighting, equipment, but not about seeing.  You know it's not the camera which takes the picture, it's the eye.

"In addition to the photojournalistic images I also enjoy doing the posed engagement and bridal portraits.  There really are some great posed photographs.  Documenting and preserving images of such an exciting time of a couple's lives is very satisfying for me. 

Recently after shooting a bride's bridal portraits I received a note from her thanking me for putting her at ease.  She said that she felt like the pictures were being taken by 'an old friend.'  When I'm able to capture great moments and posed images and I receive that kind of feedback I feel like I've been successful.  I do everything I can to have that kind of experience with every couple."

Elliott travels to non-San Antonio and non-Texas weddings.

To check Elliott's availability for your wedding date or to schedule a consultation, please call 210-680-0318. 

Visit the Fours Seasons Wedding show site.

column2: Embassy Suites by Hilton Brooks Hotel
column4:
Weddings at Embassy Suites Brooks City Base Hotel & Spa 

Congratulations on your engagement!  Allow us to partner with you in planning an event that creates warm, poignant memories.
 
The Embassy Suites Brooks City Base Hotel & Spa makes a strong commitment and takes great pride in creating an amazing experience on your very special day. We are here to collaborate with you in making each facet of your wedding magnificent.  From décor, menu planning and event coordination, our wedding professionals will guide you to craft a once in a lifetime event.  Be at ease on your wedding day knowing that every detail will be seamlessly executed.  The pinnacle of our event space is the Heritage Ballroom which seats a wedding of 500.   Hangar 9 is a unique open air event space seating 450 guests.  It was once a fully operational aircraft hangar during WWI, WWII and the Vietnam War. 

THE CEREMONY
 
The Embassy Suites Brooks City Base has several spaces where you may exchange vows.  Begin your life together as one in our intimate, romantic settings.  Ceremony packages include one-hour rehearsal one day prior to the ceremony, set specifically designed for your event, white chairs with sash based on your guest count and guest book, DJ and presentation tables in coordinating linen.
 
1917 Courtyard
The Courtyard nicely seats up to 150 guests in a variety of outdoor configurations to make your wedding unique.  It is conveniently located right off the hotel lobby, making it easy for your guests to locate.  Rental of the courtyard gives you the space privately for the duration of your ceremony as well as for concluding photos. 
 
The Lawn
The Lawn is connected just off the Heritage Ballroom Foyer.  It seats up to 175 guests.  Its simplicity provides a natural backdrop highlighting the beauty of your wedding party as you pose amongst noble trees and lush greenery.  A true Al Fresco ceremony is perfect for couples wishing to embrace the inherent beauty of their wedding day. 
 
Heritage Ballroom
The ballroom divides into four sections, all named after San Antonio missions, Concepcion, San Jose, San Juan and Espada.  The divisible ballroom can accommodate 50 to 450 guests for a spacious, open ceremony.  The ballroom perfectly blends modern elegance with classic splendor drawing attention to the warm, moving first memories as a united couple. 


THE RECEPTION

After vows are exchanged, treat yourselves and your guests to beautiful décor and culinary delights.  Embassy Suites Brooks City Base has several venues where you can celebrate your new beginning and revel with music, food and drink.  
 
Heritage Ballroom
Modern elegance defines the Heritage Ballroom.   Hosting up to 500 guests, its spacious grandeur makes it the signature event space at the Embassy Suites Brooks City Base. 
 
Hangar 9
Located less than a mile from the hotel, Hangar 9 is the oldest aircraft storage and repair facility, and the only surviving hangar from World War I.  It has been refurbished and transformed into an open-air venue that will give your wedding a one-of-a-kind experience.  It comfortably seats 450 guests inside the historic, spacious austerity.
 
The Lawn
Celebrate your wedding under the stars.  The Lawn is a whimsical reception venue that captures elegant sophistication and rustic outdoor beauty, seating up to 200 guests.  Our full linen package and candlelight centerpiece enhance your guests’ experience under the night sky.
 
1917 Courtyard
The Courtyard may also be used as an outdoor reception venue, seating up to 150 guests.  This space is ideal for wedding couples that want to combine an indoor/outdoor aesthetic.

Weddings are our Passion!

Our philosophy in life is to be passionately involved with everything we do and when it comes to your wedding, we love making your day special and memorable! Our desire is to impress people by incorporating fine taste and elegance into our work, so your wedding guests say WOW! 

Events by Touch of Elegance offers linens (retangular, square, & round), chair covers (white, ivory or black), sashes (variety of colors), table skirting (white or ivory), table decorations (head, cake, gift, sign in, and ice sculpture tables), centerpieces, wedding ceremony accessories, candelabras for the altar, wrought iron stands, benches, and pews, or unity candle holders, canopies, arches, columns, and easels.

We can provide fresh flower centerpieces and other arrangements to add to the elegance of our creations, but please note that we do not provide flowers for the wedding party members, such as bride or bridesmaid bouquets, corsages, boutonnieres, etc.

We also create spectacular theme parties for rehearsal dinners! Because the rehearsal dinner has become one of the highlights of the wedding celebration, this dinner is a wonderful opportunity to thank the wedding party for all of their help throughout the long wedding planning process.

Contact us today at 210-227-1600 or 210-273-9948 to make your event more than memorable...make it unforgettable... Make it an Event by Touch of Elegance!

Check out our feature here in San Antonio Weddings Magazine!

Everlasting marriages without the everlasting price tag!

An everlasting marriage starts with a memorable ceremony. A memorable ceremony doesn’t have to come with a high price tag.  Save money for your life together by eloping with Everlasting Elopements, Texas’ premier small wedding specialists.  

Everlasting Elopements has a wide variety of all-inclusive small wedding packages that range from a simple “I Do’ ceremony for just the couple to a full ceremony and reception for 75 guests or less.

Everlasting Elopements works with multiple scenic venues from Austin to the coastline on Mustang Island to offer couples unique and beautiful ceremony locations that are breathtaking and memorable.

Our team of professional officiants conducts customized small ceremonies in English, Spanish or both.  

With in-house floral and cake designers, photographers and videographers, our packages include everything you need to get hitched! Your ceremony will be planned and produced by our professional wedding planners.

We offer:

Civil Ceremonies starting at $75

Military Ceremonies starting at $75

Couples Only Packages starting at $549

Small Ceremony Packages starting at $699

Backyard Ceremonies starting at $999

B&B, Vacation Rental and Beach Ceremonies  starting at $1999

Ceremony and Reception Packages starting at $3500 

Extreme Elopements- Hot Air Balloons, Sky Diving, Helicopters, Ziplining and more

Each of our packages is designed to give you the complete wedding experience you have dreamed of, without the high price tag or the stress of planning!  We can also customize our packages to meet your exact needs!

Everlasting Elopements takes care of everything for you, so all you have to worry about is bringing your rings and wedding license, and looking amazing for your special day!

Getting married can be a major expense, but it doesn’t have to be. At Everlasting Elopements, we take pride in offering a variety of affordable elopement packages. Once you decide to tie the knot in Texas, you can turn to us to find a low-cost wedding officiant, an affordable wedding venue or to plan a civil ceremony. Our goal is to help you get married without breaking your budget.

Do You Want to Go Small?

We offer a variety of small-wedding packages that are both affordable and romantic. You don’t have to give up the romance and beauty of a large wedding to keep your wedding costs low.  We work with a number of small wedding venues and wedding chapels so you have your choice of beautiful locations that fit your style, whether you want to get married on the River Walk, Chapel Dulcinea, Marriage Island or a location of your choice. Browse through our wedding options to find the one that best suits you and your partner.

Sunday Civil Ceremony

$75 15 minute Quick Vow Exchange Ceremony done at the Fountains in Hemisphere Park under the Tower of Americas. Reverend Rene Esparza will be onsite from 10am to 2pm on Sundays to preform these simple ceremonies. These ceremonies are scheduled back to back and time slots will be filled consecutively. Basic vows will be read, custom vows may be read for an additional $10. Reservations still required and No Show policy does apply.  Limit to 4 Attending Guests, 2 years old and older count as guests    *** If you are having more than 4 guests, you must upgrade to the Officiant Service for $200-
Click HERE for more details

Elopement Ceremony Package

This package was specially made for those desiring a simple but elegant ceremony at one of our San Antonio or Austin Venues or a location of your choice.  It includes everything you need for a small wedding!  Have your ceremony with the picturesque backdrop of the San Antonio River Walk or overlooking the scenic Austin Hill Country at Chapel Dulcinea!
Couple’s Package $549, for Couples & their witnesses (4 guests max)
Small Wedding Package starting $699, includes 12 guests, additional guests $5/guest
Click HERE for more details
 

Backyard Ceremony Package

This package was designed for couples desiring an intimate stress-free backyard ceremony. We come set-up everything needed without the high cost of rental and delivery fees and breakdown ceremony afterwards so you can enjoy your special day with friends and family.  Starting at $549!  We bring special elements such as custom wedding arch, aisle runner, white resin chairs and more!
Click HERE for more details

Beach Wedding Packages

Servicing Corpus Christi, Mustange Island, Port Aransas and Rockport!  You pick the mile marker, hotel or other water front location and we will setup and preform an amazing beach ceremony for up to 75 guests!  Beach receptions available as well!
Click HERE for more details

Ceremony & Reception Package or Ceremony & Dinner Packages

We have partnered with some of San Antonio’s best small wedding venues and created affordable ceremony and reception packages for those couples on a tight budget. These ceremony and reception combination packages give you the complete wedding package without the high price tag and stress. Let Wedding Planner Kari Esparza take care of all the details while you enjoy your special day with your close family and friends. Venue locations: Pete’s Tako House, Augie’s BBQ, Briar Suite at Pat O’Brien’s, Casa Hernan, Guadalajara Grill and others.
Just need a private Dinner space for an hour or 2, then or Ceremony & Dinner Packages are the perfect choice!

column4:
PREPAY FOR YOUR GOWN PRESERVATION AND GET YOUR GOWN PRESSED FOR FREE!

Whether you're looking to preserve your wedding gown for years to come...or you want to restore Grandma's to wear on your special day, Five Star Wedding Gown Specialists can help!

Free Evaluation.  We will gladly give you a free consultation and estimate for the care of any fabric, new or old.

Restoration.  If the wedding gown of your dreams is a family gown that time has yellowed and stained, call us!  We specialize in restoring antique gowns to the true color without damage to delicate fabrics or dyes and our process removes stains and discoloration that ordinary dry cleaning cannot. Restoration allows you to enjoy the wonderful feeling of using a family heirloom - a family wedding gown or one of the special dresses you or someone in your family wore as a child.

Preservation:  We offer a special preservation package. With the advance purchase of any gown preservation, we will be happy to press your gown at no charge before your special day.

Our preservation package also includes anti-sugar stain treatment.  Spills containing sugar, salt, and acid often dry clear and cannot be seen.  These stains won't dissolve during ordinary dry cleaning, and in fact, will turn an ugly brown over time.  Our unique treatment ensures that all of these elements--seen or unseen--are removed permanently.

Personal Inspection Available.  Once we have cleaned your gown, we encourage you to visit our shop to inspect your gown before we complete our MuseumCare preservation process.

Final Packaging.  Because vaccum and plastic seals damage gowns, we use acid-free tissue paper to protect your gown and enclose it in a completely acid-free, archival quality wedding chest.  Acid-free windows for viewing your treasured memories are also available.

International Guarantee.  Members of the Association of Wedding Gown Specialists are represented in more than 500 cities around the world. Improper handling of the gown without the supervision of a Wedding Gown Specialist may cause damage and compromise the preservation of your gown.

Call or visit us today for a free consultation.  Our main office is located at 9606 Huebner Road, between IH-10 and Babcock.  For our other locations, please visit our website.

Five Star Cleaners...San Antonio's Most Respected Dry Cleaners!

With 10 years of experience in the music entertainment industry, we at Four40Entertainment believe in providing the highest quality in sound and lighting design for your special event.  Our name itself speaks volumes in the realm of music.  The term A-440 in the music industry serves as the tuning standard for sound pitch.

Our goal at Four40Entertainment is to provide the absolute best service in music and lighting design, customized to make your wedding reception the perfect one!  We focus on creating the most memorable experience for the bride, groom and guests by providing you with services that will leave everyone with everlasting impressions of an enjoyable evening!  We target the dance floor and make it our mission to create a fun atmosphere that generates the rapport needed to connect people with the past, present and future.  Four40Entertainment recognizes peoples’ needs and enthusiasm for dancing and strives to make your celebration the one everyone keeps talking about!

Lizzette Suarez is a creative San Antonio florist and specialist in event planning for weddings and the corporate sector. Lizzette founded her company from His garden in 2004 and it is now a leading name in luxurious flower arrangements for events around San Antonio and the surrounding areas of the Alamo City. Lizzette specializes in following the vision of her clients and provides a myriad of options to the design of every event. Her attention to details comes from over 18 years of experience in the corporate industry; she’s trusted for her ability to be articulate and having a fresh outlook on decor. Lizzette is a trusted source among peers in the wedding and corporate industry and her client’s testimonies prove she is one of the best.

In addition to being an entrepreneur, Lizzette is also a Board Member on the San Antonio Chapter of NAWBO (National Association of Women Business Owners) and serves as Chair for the Women Business Owner Awards Gala committee which celebrates women business owners impacting the San Antonio Community.  Lizzette also serves in the NAWBO San Antonio High School Connections  committee which was created by NAWBO San Antonio in 1999 to encourage young women to explore entrepreneurship as a means to financial independence and career satisfaction and serves as one of the mentors for young women. 

Lizzette will soon complete her Graduate studies in Organizational Development from The University of the Incarnate Word where she also completed her Undergraduate studies earning a Bachelor of Arts in Human Resources.

column4:
Chris Koval is the driving force behind Future Sounds Disc Jockey Service. His entertainment background began in in television in 1985. He worked in sound and lighting production for several bands and in clubs during the late 80's and 90's. He polished his technical skills through work in radio production and commercial editing. Koval worked as an on-air personality for several stations throughout Texas for 10 years.

His experience with the wedding industry began in early 1993 and this led to the formation of Future Sounds in 1998. Since that time, he has focused primarily on wedding receptions averaging 50 per year but also has fun working with school events and company functions averaging an additional 40 events per year. Chris Koval is well-known, a respected professional and business in the mobile entertainment industry as well as wedding industry. He specializes in more than playing music; his specialty is providing his clients with a complete entertainment experience. This experience spans over 30 years and over 1800 weddings and nearly a 1500 other events. Preparation, organization and coordination are all part of the process that has led to the success for Chris and Future Sounds DJ Service L.L.C.. Future Sounds celebrates 20 years of service in November 2018.

Academically, Chris worked for 15 years in higher education. Chris has a B.A. in Technical Communication and a M. Ed. with a focus in Instructional Technology. You can find Chris Koval on LinkedIn to view his other professional achievements.

Why choose Chris Koval and Future Sounds? He and his company are well-rounded and grounded! Chris Koval has been doing businesses as Future Sounds since 1998. He has a proven positive record of accomplishment and longevity in his trade. He has a successful business, industry experience, and technical knowledge. He has the ability to adapt, apply, and implement tools and equipment at a moment’s notice. He has a passion that drives him to attain success and show it in his work and in his trade. In addition to his 30 years of experience in the entertainment industry in all facets of the field, Koval supports his trade with an educated foundation. He is the only DJ in San Antonio with a Master’s in Education supported by a Bachelor’s in Technical Communication. Chris Koval is goal oriented and can communicate! He can direct, manage, and collaborate with individuals, groups and cultures. Large or small, Chris Koval has the ability to make your event a success. Find client testimonials and endorsements on his website or on other major wedding sites on the web.

Weddings - Gruene Estate

Gruene Estate, the original Gruene homestead, spreads over 15 acres in New Braunfels, Texas. The secluded property consists of several structures including the 1857 home of Ernst and Antoinette Gruene, a charming open air wedding chapel with antique European stained glass windows, and a iron bell tower, as well as an open air pavilion and other historical housing.

Weddings - Gruene Estate

Accomodating up to 12 overnight guests and 250 event guests, Gruene Estate is an ideally situated location for those looking for an elegant Texas country wedding near Austin and San Antonio.

column4:
Guadalajara Grill - In La Villita Historic Arts Village in the heart of downtown San Antonio.

Established in 1991, The Guadalajara Grill specializes in traditional cuisine from Old Mexico and is located in the stately McAllister Building which was built in 1854. The inviting atmosphere of the Grill is the perfect space for Weddings and Rehearsal Dinners of up to 99 guests.

The Private Dining Room is on the second floor above the restaurant. Its charming ambiance is created by the original limestone walls, hardwood floors, and numerous paned windows displaying views of La Villita, the Tower of the Americas and Hemisfair Park.

Recently remodeled, the room has a distinctive handcrafted Bar constructed from native mesquite and cedar woods. A dramatic cascade of several hundred imported blown-glass crystals in hues of red, green and blue is suspended from the ceiling the entire length of the room. On the ceiling, there is a series of handscripted verses, poems and lyrics adding to the romantic setting. A mirrored wall treatment gives the space a contemporary touch.

Our accommodating staff is available to make your reception or rehearsal dinner a memorable celebration. Whether you wish to serve from our typical Mexican fare or from a customized menu, we are ready to provide you with personalized attention and genuine hospitality in a truly original setting in this Nationally Registered Historical Landmark.

For more information, please contact Tina Hinojosa at 210-222-1992 or 210-710-8241 or visit Guadalajara Grill.

Hacienda Santa Maria is honored to be part of your unforgettable day!

Every bride meticulously plans the details of her wedding day.  Likewise, Hacienda Santa Maria has thoroughly fashioned its interior and exterior décor.  From Saltillo and Talavera tiling to custom-made artisan seating from Monterrey, Mexico, this Spanish-influenced 5,000 square foot property is the perfect location to begin your happily-ever after.  Complete with a landscaped patio, private bridal room, free parking and handcrafted architectural details, our Hacienda is your Hacienda.

The main room hosts a dance floor, extensive audio visual capabilities and seating for up to 250 guests.  The Saltillo-tiled patio features a tranquil water fountain and vibrant flowers, perfect for an evening cocktail and hors d’oeuvres reception prior to the main course.

Delectable cuisine is provided in-house, created by award-winning Executive Chef, Flora Maria Pozo, graduate of the Center for the Foods of the Americas.  A variety of menu options and floor plans are available.

Hacienda Santa Maria is conveniently located just north of downtown, with easy access to Hwy 281 and I-35.

For additional information, please visit Hacienda Santa Maria or contact Gonzalo Pozo at (210) 685-3123 to schedule an appointment.

column4:
Located in the beautiful Hill Country, Harper Hill Ranch is an event venue with lots of charm.

Situated on an 88-acre ranch right outside of New Braunfels and San Marcos, Harper Hill Ranch is a unique event venue that opened in the Fall of 2018. Nestled in the trees up on a hill, you’ll find the ideal space for your wedding, banquet, corporate retreat, quinceañera, family reunion, and more.

You’ll fall in love with our beautiful stained glass windows and sparkling chandeliers that hang in our temperature-controlled Barn. From the stamped concrete floor to the tin ceilings to the reclaimed wood doors, our carefully-planned details set us apart from other venues. The barn features over 4000 square feet of event space, along with a bride room, groom room, caterer’s kitchen, silo bathrooms, and a covered outdoor patio.

Take a step back in time when you enter the Ranch House that has origins from the 1880’s. It is full of historical character, while also providing modern conveniences to make your stay as comfortable as possible. With space to sleep up to 22 people, the house also provides many spaces to entertain. Included with the house is a covered outdoor kitchen; a large pool with a swim-up bar, grotto, waterfall and hot tub; basketball and volleyball courts; and many other amenities for you to enjoy.

Book a tour today to see and feel firsthand the allure of Harper Hill Ranch. We think you’ll like it.

 

When you come out for a visit, you’re sure to meet our ranch kitties, as well as some friendly longhorns and our adorable miniature donkeys - Louis Vuitton, Prince Henry and Mr. Big.

column4:
A True San Antonio Experience in a perfect location. Nothing will make you happier than celebrating your special day along the romantic River Walk at Hilton Palacio del Rio. Hilton has the perfect location for every style, offering fabulous views of the River Walk and Downtown Skyline. As the longest Four Diamond award-winning hotel in San Antonio, Palacio del Rio offers delightful meals, polished service & superior guest rooms.

Our $35 million renovation is now complete!  Each Ballroom features a Modern & Sophisticated Style with views of the San Antonio River Walk or Downtown Skyline.
 
The graceful Salon del Rey Ballroom, offering seating for 400, features all-new, floor-to-ceiling windows and understated light sconces displaying the classic San Antonio quatrefoil design.

Your special event may be set in Hilton Palacio del Rio’s premier venue, the Stetson.  Offering simple elegance with an unparalleled River Walk view, Brazilian red wood paneled walls and richly appointed furnishings create a lasting impression.
 
Nestled on the fifth floor with lush foliage and a beautiful gazebo, the Terrace Garden will entice and delight your guests! It is an oasis in the heart of the city and a perfect outdoor venue for your Wedding Ceremony, or cocktails and hors d'oeuvres.

The La Vista Ballroom and El Mirador Ballroom, located on the 22nd floor, offer impressive 360° views of the San Antonio skyline.

The Pavilion by Hilton is a brilliantly re-cut jewel located in HemisFair Park. A limestone and wood structure built in the late 1800's, the historic building has been completely restored into an elegant, self-contained venue located across the street from the hotel.

Leave the intricate details of your special day in the experienced hands of Hilton Palacio del Rio. For more information, please call 210-224-3393!

Holy Trinity Banquet Hall is a place where people can come together to celebrate the gift of life. 

We offer an elegantly appointed, spacious 9,000 square foot facility that needs only your imagination to be transformed into the ballroom of your dreams.

Our fully carpeted banquet hall boasts 22 foot ceilings, a 1,000 square foot polished wood dance floor, and 72" round tables and cathedral chairs to accommodate up to 500 guests.  With state-of-the-art technology, we can also light the room 8,000 different ways!  These extras, along with set-up, and clean-up, are all included in the rental of the room at no extra charge.

We also offer a great central location in the prestigious Stone Oak area, beautiful grounds, ample set-up time, and plenty of free parking.  Our commercial kitchen is available for use by your outside caterers, and we are happy to recommend vendors for all of your wedding day needs. 

Please contact our Facilities Manager for a personal tour.  We look forward to sharing in your celebration!

Have a Spa Party for your Bridal Party!

Our spa parties are amazing and we reserve the entire 3,000 sq. ft. salon for your party. We have a couple of party options that I recommend and are our most popular.  Your spa event usually lasts 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 hours depending on option 1 or 2. 

1.     Head/neck/shoulder and back massage 

2.     Mini-cleanse facial   

3.     Hand treatment including paraffin, exfoliation, hand/arm massage with reflexology    

4.     Detox foot soak with reflexology and foot/leg massage.

Option 1--Choice of 2 services, a gift certificate to Shades of Love (downstairs), wine assortment, tea, coffee, finger foods (veggie tray/ fruit tray/cheeses) keepsake candid photos.  Per person: $135.

Option 2--Choice of 4 services, a gift certificate to Shades of Love (downstairs), wine assortment, tea, coffee, finger foods (veggie tray/ fruit tray/cheeses/meats) and a chocolate fountain and keepsake candid photos.  Per  person:$180.

Please let us know when you would like to book the date so that we can accommodate your party.  Of course, if you have any questions feel free to call me at the salon  210-384-0134.  Each spa party is unique so if you have any ideas for your group we can visit to make a memorable experience.  Having a spa party for a bachelorette party is a great way to enjoy your evening and wake up refreshed. To reserve your evening we require half down and the balance due at the beginning of the party.

IVY HALL

Tim the Girl manages, and is the exclusive caterer for, Ivy Hall, a stunning event space in San Antonio’s King William neighborhood. Ivy Hall offers both interior and exterior event space, and can be rented as a whole, or in smaller portions.
 
The Gardens: a lush green oasis for dinners, dancing, concerts, photo shoots, ceremonies, and more under the stars. Includes a funky container building perfect for an outdoor bar, VIP area, or staging area.
 
Ivy Hall: A charming vine-covered converted warehouse with elegantly appointed restrooms, a staging area, and other amenities. Ready for lectures, dinners, screenings, art exhibits, fundraisers, and more.
 
The Patio: an intimate space surrounded by bamboo and fairy lights, the patio makes a perfect preview or reception area before your guests proceed through to the Gardens.

column4:
Host your next special event at The Jingu House and Japanese Tea Gardens.

Fresh Horizons Creative Catering isproud to be the exclusive caterer at the Japanese Tea Garden and the historic Jingu House. Since 1981, Fresh Horizons has been serving San Antonio and South Texas.


The Garden is the most romantic, unique and picturesque garden located in San Antonio. Adjacent to Brackenridge Park, the Tea Gardens feature beautiful floral displays, a waterfall and a safe habitat for new Koi and aquatic plants. It is an extraordinary example of the ruse of an old rock quarry which dates back to 1899 and remnants can still be seen in the garden's architecture.

The Japanese Tea Garden, or Sunken Gardens, is a registered Texas historical landmark. The garden opened in an abandoned limestone rock quarry in the early 20th century. It was known also as Chinese Tea Gardens, Chinese Tea Garden Gate, Chinese Sunken Garden Gate and is listed on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places.

This outdoor venue is perfect for an intimate ceremony or elegant gala under the stars for up to 300 guests.

Daytime Wedding Ceremonies: 
The Japanese Tea Gardens offers three wonderful locations for your Wedding Ceremony:
- The Waterfall for up to 10 guests

- The Lower Garden for up to 20 guests

- The Pagoda for up to 50 guests

Evening Weddings; 
The enchanting Japanese Tea Garden becomes a private location for your wedding ceremony and reception.  Host an intimate affair or gala event for up to 300 under the stars. 

The Jingu House
Experience the romance of the Japanese Tea Garden and an afternoon luncheon.  The Jingu House Café is the perfect location for an intimate luncheon. Luncheon menu features Sandwiches & Light Snacks or Traditional Bento Box luncheon available.

The Jingu House is available for evening receptions and parties. Host your event in the Lambert Room, the Patio or simply make a reservation.

It's the service we provide for every person that will make your experience with Fresh Horizons as unique and satisfying as your event. No detail is ever too small.

column4:
"Upgrade your wedding."

Tony Bennett says: "Joe, your voice sounds beautiful. Keep singing!" (Click Audio).

Joe Caruso and his superb trio (piano, bass and drums) perform swingin' standards from various eras.

Songs include: "The Way You Look Tonight," "Fly Me To the Moon," "New York State of Mind" and "What A Wonderful World."

Swinging the Great American Songbook, as well as other pop standards and love songs, Joe relies on a vocal technique called the bel canto (Italian, "beautiful singing") method. Tony Bennett once said that as a student of this discipline, he was taught to get to the center of the note, and that this is the essence of bel canto singing. A protege of Mr. Bennett, Joe is renowned for his great phrasing, clarity of diction and sheer thrill of sound. 

FAQ:

What are your rates?

Each event is unique (date, location, length, etc.). We offer variable pricing.

What can I expect?

From San Antonio to San Francisco, the name Joe Caruso is synonymous with quality.

From the shine on his shoes to the dimple in his tie, before Joe even sings a note, it's obvious he is intent on excellence. Joe says, "I take great pride in making certain every detail is just right, and that the music be the soundtrack to a fairytale evening you and your guests will remember forever."

Can you also serve as emcee?

Yes. An award-winning broadcaster for over 25 years, Joe will make the perfect emcee for your event.

We'd like you to play during cocktails and dinner, then have a DJ for the remainder of the reception. Is that an option?

Yes. Joe has hand-selected a professional club DJ who works with him on such occasions.

For availability, or if you have questions, call or text Joe at: 847.331.0247

These are REAL photos, of REAL couples, during REAL events! Our team is trained to capture these moments as they happen, all while creating art that you will love for a lifetime. Anyone can take a photo of something beautiful that is sitting and waiting. Very few can predict the moment before it happens and capture it as it does!

Here at Jonathan Ivy Photography we have a passion for photography and capturing your most cherished moment.  We do wedding photography primarily in San Antonio, the Texas Hill Country, Austin, and the Texas Coastal Bend.  But for years we have also been seen in Houston, The Woodlands, Dallas and Ft Worth plus we are available for destination wedding photography worldwide.  We also provide services for: portraiture as well as editorial/commerical work (http://www.jonathanivy.com).

With every full wedding package, Jonathan Ivy Photography provides a wedding album, 2 photographers and a master digital copy of your wedding photos in high resolution. We also offer custom design work in order to preserve the memory for you and your guests.   We offer flush-mounted and matted styled albums that chronicle the most memorable moments from your special day.  Think of this as your family's first heirloom!

Jonathan Ivy Photography will capture your cherished memories and transform them into inimitable, visually stunning photos that will last a lifetime.  If you have an upcoming event you would love to commemorate, we would love to work with you. 

Contact us to set up an appointment:
info@jonathanivyphoto.com or 281.224.1937

- Thanks, Jonathan & Samantha

Your wedding is one of the most special days of your life. Every element is carefully chosen to represent the beauty of this day. The music you choose will be the soundtrack as you remember the day you say “I do.” Rest assured, that your vision is as important to me as it is to you. With a vast wedding and liturgical music library, and over 20 years of experience of planning wedding and liturgical music, I can help you choose music that will complement and enhance your celebration. Already have that special song in mind? I will sing that too! In serving you as a vocalist, my goal is to envelope you and all that are present in music that will fill your souls!

Singing since age 4, I have grown as a vocalist and a musician. Outside of singing as a wedding vocalist, I have had the opportunity to perform for Premier Designs Jewelry Company, lent my voice to the “Hope for Tomorrow” campaign for the United Way in the Chicagoland area, and even co-written two Christian musicals. Performing has always been something I love, but my faith and music are at the core of who I am. I guarantee professionalism, but with a very personal touch. Should you need assistance with finding other musicians, I am happy to help you with that! You can have confidence that in choosing me, I will help make the music in your heart be heard!

column4:
An Elegant Day Awaits You!

Kendall Point is set back in the Texas Hill Country atop a limestone kissed hill. Nestled among century old oaks and a natural spring fed pond, the Plantation offers brides an elegant and romantic venue for their dream wedding.

True Southern charm and exceptional hospitality is felt all around the property with oversized wraparound porches and giant white columns that make a dramatic impression.

Let The Point do your decorating for you inside the ballroom outfitted with a grand staircase and wrought iron hand rails. Beautiful cascading chandeliers and 23 foot ceilings will leave you with unforgettable photo backdrops.

Outdoor sites under century old oak trees with Spanish moss are romantic under our lit gazebo for sunset weddings overlooking the pond with fountain.

For indoor weddings have your guests wait your arrival in the ballroom while you step down a dream staircase and meet your fiance at the landing for a perfect ceremony spot with monumental windows behind you.

Dance the night away with giant French doors opened up and the hill country breeze coming through the plantation for a true natural feeling.

 For more information, please call 830-229-5090 or contact Kristin via email to setup your tour appointment.

column4:
Message from our owner:

Hello and welcome to Khalil & Co. I'm so excited you're considering us to make you look and feel beautiful. Since I'll (hopefully) be getting to know you personally as a lot of our customers become not only clients but friends, here is a little bit about who I am and how this company started.

 I grew up in San Antonio, Texas and went to school and graduated from the Mays School of Business with a Bachelors in Supply Chain Management from Texas A&M University.

When I was in college I spent 2.5 years as a glamour model. I've been published in all sorts of amazing magazines including Maxim.com and Maxim.co.za (Maxim South Africa). Once I became pregnant with my handsome baby boy (that is now 4!) I decided to leave that life behind me, finish my degree, and get the logistics job I had always dreamed of. 

Once I was in the job I felt something missing. In August of 2015 I opened up as Adriana Khalil Makeup Artistry only having one client for the entire month. There was some sort of happiness I got from making that one girl look and feel beautiful that I decided to keep on and start marketing my services. I quickly grew and I was constantly asked to bring a hairstylist with me... and from there Khalil & Co. was born. Now we are a collection of makeup artists and hairstylists that become your glamour team. One year after opening we were named by TheKnot.com as the Best of Weddings for 2017. We just received the award again for 2018!

 With that being said, I am excited to start this journey with you.  Please contact me with any and every question you may have and I hope to meet you soon.

 - Adriana

ABOUT
Overlooking the Texas Hill Country, La Cantera Resort & Spa is situated on a 550 acre tranquil oasis just minutes from San Antonio’s finest shopping, dining, and entertainment. Emerging from a multi-million dollar transformation, the 496-room resort features five sparkling pools, two championship golf courses, a relaxing Spa and nine incredible dining options. The Resort offers more than 115,000 square feet of event space including two ballrooms and 28 meeting rooms. Whether your big day will be shared with 20 guests or 500, La Cantera Resort is uniquely equipped to ensure that everything goes smoothly. The award winning culinary team and dedicated catering staff will work with you to craft the menu of a lifetime. Out of town guests will appreciate the resort’s amenities and convenient location, just 20 minutes from the San Antonio airport, downtown San Antonio, and immediately adjacent to The Shops at La Cantera.

CATERING
Our award winning culinary team and dedicated wedding specialist will work with you to create your personalized guest experience.

VENUES
We can accommodate ceremonies for up to 350 guests, with receptions for up to 800 guests. We offer several stunning outdoor venues for your ceremony (an indoor back-up is always included), and beautiful indoor reception spaces.

SPA
Loma De Vida - OPENING LATE SUMMER 2016

Loma de Vida Spa & Wellness will be a secluded sanctuary immersed in nature and situated on one of the highest points in San Antonio with breathing views of the Texas sky. The spa will invoke the spirit of the Hill Country and Texas to inspire traditional spa offerings (massages, facials), signature experiences indigenous to the area and results orientated services integrating technology and nature to create a true sense of balanced well-being.

GOLF
Among the “Best Courses in Texas”- GolfWeek 2015, The Resort Course and Palmer Courses offer a combined 36-holes of championship golf and some of the most scenic vistas in the Texas Hill Country.

GUEST ACCOMODATIONS
Make your wedding weekend a destination or staycation, and take advantage of exclusive guestroom rates for your family and friends. Our recently renovated rooms were thoughtfully refined, putting a fine polish on relaxed sophistication. Plush carpeting and new beds with luxurious linens welcome you, while transformative amenities surprise and delight throughout your stay. Every room at La Cantera Resort & Spa exudes relaxed sophistication. From exceptional, elevated views to transformative amenities that pique all of your senses, you’ll feel luxuriously welcomed and leave brilliantly renewed.

column4:
Breathtakingly beautiful and remarkably exquisite.


The Lambermont, located within just steps from the renowned Fort Sam Houston, offers a romantic and uniquely charming spot to hold your next celebration.

With its exquisite craftsmanship and detailed artistry, you’ll be transported to another time and place. This historic and elegant castle built in the late 1800s, captures the French-style chateaus and Belgium-inspired castles of northern Europe.

To this day, the castle continues to be representative to its time. Adorned with crystal chandeliers, hand-carved woodwork, molded brick fireplaces, original cabinetwork and rich hardwood floors, this venue captures more than the luxurious and elegant Victorian era.

The castle is situated on a 1-acre corner lot surrounded by a large variety of lush greenery with an open yard space ideal for gatherings. The porch, embellished with large beams and limestone balustrades, is the perfect location to relax and take in the enchantment of this lavish castle.

For more information, please call Dona Liston at 210-271-9145 or visit our website.

column4:
First things first, as a wedding photographer, I have to make it clear that I cherish love....in ALL it's forms. I do not discriminate on your relationship. I do not sit in judgment because, honestly...how can you judge love? You come to me because you want to celebrate that you have found the one you want to live the journey of life with, and that makes me so proud to be a part of it. I am happy to give EVERYONE a great experience and amazing images to last forever. Everyone who works within my company has the same attitude toward love, and you'll never have to worry about judgement here. Now that that is said...

      Are you looking for a unique experience with a skilled photographer who can handle anything? Then look no further! If you are looking for a fad photographer who relies on Photoshop to either fix errors that should have been corrected in camera to begin with or to make their images sale-able? Then please, stop reading...OK, now you serious photo peeps, I am happy to tell you about what to expect at Rukavina Photography.

     We are primarily, a wedding photography studio, but that does not mean that we can not shoot your seniors, families, babies, maternity, fashion etc. We love everyone and have trained in every genre of photography, so we are well equipped to handle anything you  may need.

     We make it our mission, in our work, to bring joy to the lives of those we shoot. What is it that we want to remember? It is the emotion of the moment, whether it be the sweet calm of a newborn baby, the giddy laughter of a child, the excitement of the unknown and promising future of a graduating senior, the beauty of true love at an engagement or wedding? Why, all of it, of course! We, as photographers, can sometimes forget that we are shooting people, most of these images are not for magazine covers or awards. We are capturing a memory for you. A memory that will never come into our lives again...That is an amazing gift your are giving us. We get caught up in the thrill of victory that we sometimes forget to capture humanity. That is something that we promise you that we will never forget. ;)

Since you're probably here to learn about my work, and not my philosophy on life, I'll get started...

 My love of photography began as a child. The magic of capturing a moment in time has always been exciting for me. For some reason, however, I started out as a Fine Art major in college. After a few semesters, I changed it to my first love...photography. I realized that I was no Michelangelo (who happens to be my favorite Renaissance Man) when I tried sculpting and I certainly needed help with my painting skills. Thankfully, I had a great couple of Art professors who had a ton of patience. The skills I learned there, definitely help me in my creation of art digitally. I also learned from my Photography professors that no amount of digital manipulation can fix an image if you don't master the light first. This involved studying not only natural light, but off camera flash, strobes and creating light in unusual ways. I can't sculpt like Michelangelo, as I said before, but I certainly have learned to sculpt my subjects with light! 

      After college, I just knew I was going to be a world-renowned photographer immediately because my passion was so strong. However, a person has got to eat, so life got in the way a bit :) But, thanks to my incredible husband and family, I was able to pick up where I left off after my youngest was born in 2006.

 I am the luckiest person in the world. I get to earn a living doing something that I not only have a passion for, but it is what I was meant to do. It is a rare gift to be able to follow your passion, and I recognize that with every shoot.Nothing makes me feel more alive than when I am creating my own little masterpieces.

I use my background in art to help me create the images that you see in my portfolio to this day. Mastering lighting techniques to create the mood you want is a very difficult, but extremely rewarding experience. I enjoy discovering where the image takes me in post-processing as well. Michelangelo once said, " Every block of stone has a statue inside it, and it is the task of the sculptor to discover it." He was also smart enough to realize that he was still learning. I use the examples of the masters of the past and try my best to take a little bit of their genius and apply that standard of excellence to my work. I am constantly studying new techniques and I keep up to date with the latest ideas, however, I am not one to rely on fad techniques. I can, and often do, use new techniques to create an edgy image, but I can also sculpt the light, which is a must in this profession. You can be assured that I have studied many years and I take this very seriously, even though I come off as a big ole goofball most of the time ;). I push myself every day to become better and better. That is something that HAS to be done in this business. Aside from the fundamental skills and knowledge required to be a professional photographer, the only  aspect of this job that you can bet on is that it is constantly changing and growing to new heights. It's very exciting!

I enjoy this "job" so much that it does not seem like work to me at all. I have a great time, and I make it my mission to make sure my customers have a great time also.

 I greatly appreciate you taking the time to get to know a little about me and my work. I can promise you that I give everything I have to these portraits and I am always willing to listen to your input. After all, you are the subject of my work! I look forward to working with you all and I thank you in advance for allowing me the opportunity to be part of your lives, even if it's just for a moment!

 

-Linda
